title: Depression Evaluation Test
description: This questionnaire is designed to help you reflect on your recent emotional and physical well-being. By answering the following questions honestly, you’ll gain insight into how you’ve been feeling and identify areas where you might need support. Each question is paired with options that measure how often you’ve experienced certain feelings or behaviors, ranging from 'Not at all' to 'Nearly every day'. Remember, there are no right or wrong answers—just be truthful about your experiences.

questions.question: Little interest or pleasure in doing things.
Trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or sleeping too much.
Feeling tired or having little energy.
Feeling bad about yourself—or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down.
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television.
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed; or the opposite—being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual.
Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself in some way.
